definition: Physical electrical elements that perform specific functions within electronic circuits and systems.

positive_examples: The capacitor stores electrical energy in the power supply circuit.
Replace the faulty inductor coil in the radio frequency filter.
The solenoid valve controls fluid flow when energized.
Check all resistors and transistors on the circuit board.
The transfer switch automatically connects to backup power.
Measure the voltage across each component in the amplifier circuit.
negative_examples: The oscilloscope displays the circuit's waveform patterns.
Program the microcontroller to handle sensor inputs.
The circuit board substrate provides mechanical support.
Install the latest firmware update on the device.
The power adapter converts AC to DC voltage.
Use proper ESD protection when handling electronics.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: TestInstruments, ElectronicDevices, PowerSystems, SignalProcessing
